channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A number of holes and damaged repairs, 6th October
item.description:
Around the roundabout by the Meadow cafe, Turkey.marker.only The holes and the broken repair ls are large enough to unseat a cyclist.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Part of road sign hanging off., 6th October
item.description:
Sign on the right (heading into town), outside property 108/110 London Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 93, London Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Abandoned traffic signs, 6th October
item.description:
Road work sign in Kate Lane, just passed football ground and bungalow to wards Southam Lane. This was left by Severn Trent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34,36, Kayte Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very bad broken road surface from outside the sports field back to Meadoway, 6th October
item.description:
The road outside the entrance to the sportsfield in Bishops Cleeve has been in a bad state for a long time and during rebuilding there a lot of heavy vehicles have made it worse. It is a horrible effect if you use the buses and very uncomfortable for passengers.Why is so much money spent on a cycle path when the road is left in this state?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 81b Station Rd. Bishops cleeve, 6th October
item.description:
A very poor attempt was made some time ago, but did not address the problem, it is impossible to swerve to avoid it as the road is too narrow when there is oncoming traffic. Are these repairs ever checked because this one is a complete waste of public money?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Station Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road an footbridge under train line, 6th October
item.description:
If see the state please insect. If can report to the railway. It is about time. Stop qualification an gets Laborers as Street Sweeper just for temporary. Only needs health and safety induction. We needs all the bushes clear. Needs inspection. Check report for any damage. Please be aware. I try to help Open Door Cheltenham homeless Centre. They cutting down the bush trees fence. But needs Railway to sort out an solution. With they premises separate the overside. Please inspect what Open door doing. Nothing to help homeless. They closed on Friday Saturday. They not working for the Emergency Service just making they profit an donâ€™t care not getting no one back on track. Giving away free benefit Claim an find accommodation. Why not help with work an find accommodation. If take out Confession they willing not to knows all the stranger but read through Henry full life story an never do the same to all the homeless. They don't even help Henry with shelter he willing to find jobs. He told Fraud Scammed DWP PIP Mobility plus Housing Benefit cancel his compensation in construction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wire and plastic, 6th October
item.description:
Wire cable and plastic covering dumped. Valuable copper appears to have been stripped from this presumably stolen cabling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Giant fungus has lifted the paving just outside our property., 6th October
item.description:
The problem is outside our property at 29 St. Luke's Road, Cheltenham, close to the Silver Birch Tree on the pavement outside our house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, St Lukes Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Wheel left dumped after joyriders returned to fix wheel and drive off., 6th October
item.description:
Nearest properties are Ashton Grove/ Rushworth Close. Thrown against hedge on corner of park next to carpark which joyriders had abandoned car early hours of Saturday morning. Police were informed of incident and a police aware sign was left on vehicle. Sunday lunchtime men returned to fix tireless wheel but decided to fly tip it into hedge in park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Rushworth Close, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 6th October
item.description:
Highway tree - corner of Charlton Close and Regis Close I have been contacted by a local resident about the loss of this tree, I understand it was not properly staked and has now been removed. Can I ask that it is replaced in the next planting season please,
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandone Vehicle in dangerous location, 6th October
item.description:
The vehicle is parked opposite the exit to 3 houses, the nearest house to the road is the Pynot. It is difficult to exit the driveway, particularly when other vehicles are coming from the left and right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

NWD WITH GIVE AND TAKE PLUS TEMPORARY FOOTWAY CLOSURE PLEASE CUT OFF X2 2 METERS X1 METER DAMAGED PEDESTRIAN RAILINGS AND TEMPORARY TARMAC HOLES TO MAKE SAFE (Damaged Street Furniture)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
